For Zion's sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem's sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, and the salvation thereof as a lamp <FI>that<Fi> burneth.
And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the LORD shall name.
Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the LORD, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.

Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be called Hephzibah, and thy land Beulah: for the LORD delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.<RF>Hephzibah: that is, My delight is in her<Rf><RF>Beulah: that is, Married<Rf>

For <FI>as<Fi> a young man marrieth a virgin, <FI>so<Fi> shall thy sons marry thee: and <FI>as<Fi> the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, <FI>so<Fi> shall thy God rejoice over thee.<RF>as the…: Heb. with the joy of the bridegroom<Rf><CM>

I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, <FI>which<Fi> shall never hold their peace day nor night: ye that make mention of the LORD, keep not silence,<RF>make…: or, are the LORD's remembrancers<Rf>
And give him no rest, till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.<RF>rest: Heb. silence<Rf>

The LORD hath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy corn <FI>to be<Fi> meat for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:<RF>Surely…: Heb. If I give, etc<Rf>
But they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise the LORD; and they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.<CM>
Go through, go through the gates; prepare ye the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a standard for the people.

Behold, the LORD hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, his reward <FI>is<Fi> with him, and his work before him.<RF>work: or, recompence<Rf>
And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the LORD: and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.<CM>
